trans-unit.source: Scales and rotates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
TransformedBitmap supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90Â° increments and scale transforms.
Transforms that skew the image are not supported.
TransformedBitmap implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.
Property changes can only occur during object initialization.

Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.

TransformedBitmap objects created using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Transform%29> constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.

To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> class that has the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source*> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform*>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform*> of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> instance.
The source parameter is .
The newTransform parameter is .
-or- The transform is not an orthogonal transform.
Signals the start of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between BeginInit and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> is currently being initialized.
BeginInit has already been called.
-or- The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> has already been initialized.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
Signals the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and EndInit calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source*> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform*> properties are <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
-or- The transform is not an orthogonal transform.
-or- The EndInit method is called without first calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit*>.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets or sets the source for the bitmap.

You can chain a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> to another <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by setting the Source property of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> that you want.
See [How to: Chain BitmapSource Objects Together](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for an example of chaining.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The source for the bitmap.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Source*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref>, which specifies the scale or rotation of the bitmap.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90 increments and scale transforms.
Transforms that skew the image are not supported.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref>, which specifies the scale or rotation of the bitmap.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Media.Transform.Identity*>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.Transform*> dependency property.
To be added.
